snippet: Parishioners in Scituate, Mass., have occupied a Roman Catholic church to keep it from closing, the last of a handful of such battles still going.
abstract: Group of parishioners of St Frances Xavier Cabrini Church in Scituate, Mass, have held vigil in deconsecrated church for nearly 11 years since Archdiocese of Boston closed parish, along with many others in region, in 2004; were sued by archdiocese in Massachusetts Superior Court and have filed appeal to ruling which said they are trespassing; have lost appeal to Apostolic Signatura, Vatican's highest court, and similar vigils to keep other area churches open have long since ended.
lead_paragraph: Parishioners in Scituate, Mass., have occupied a Roman Catholic church to keep it from closing, the last of a handful of such battles still going.

headline.main: Catholics Defy Boston Archdiocese With 11-Year Vigil to Keep Church
headline.print_headline: Members’ 11-Year Vigil Defies Plan to Close Church in Boston Archdiocese

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: St Frances Xavier Cabrini Church (Scituate, Mass)
